topdown

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Canvas
        • topdown.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class Game
extends java.awt.Canvas
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Main class which runs the program and holds the most important methods used to keep track of essential game elements/information.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Isaac Jimenez, Nicholas English, Suman Gurung
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.awt.Canvas

        java.awt.Component.AccessibleAWTComponent, java.awt.Component.BaselineResizeBehavior, java.awt.Component.BltBufferStrategy, java.awt.Component.FlipBufferStrategy

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Game()
      Constructor initializes many of the instance variables created above and creates the window on which the game will run, adds keyControls, adds a mouseListener, and calls on two methods used to begin the game.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkIfWon()
      Declares the player a winner if all of the enemy objects have been removed.
      void clearGame()
      Clears the game of all items in the handle list.
      int getFrameCount()
      Returns the integer value for the frames per second for the current game.
      int getHEIGHT()
      Returns an integer value for the height of the current game screen.
      State getState()
      Returns the State object for the state of the game currently.
      int getWIDTH()
      Returns an integer value for the width of the current game screen.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Main method is called when the program begins and creates the instance of Game that will be used within all classes that demand and instance of Game.
      void render()
      Renders the screen and updates the screen constantly.
      void reset()
      Resets the game screen by clearing the game and then setting up the game.
      void run()
      Method used as the "engine" of the game, which keeps it running and continuously updates all aspects of the game.
      void setFrameCount(int frameCount)
      Sets the frames per second based on the integer value passed.
      void setState(State state)
      Sets the state of the game based on the State object passed.
      void setUpGame()
      Sets up the game by adding all of the enemy and player objects to the game.
      void start()
      Begins the game with the thread.
      void stop()
      Stops the game and exits the program.
      void tick()
      Based on the current state of the game, it runs the tick function through the handle.
